content:
er 26, 2013
												So let me sum this game up.  This will be comming from someone who likes playing MOBAS regularly. 1. Moba with only a few maps giving you lanes, not the same kind of lanes in a traditional MOBA since, but lanes none the less that allows you to flank and take objectives through an ambush type of take over. 2. Most, if not all other Mobas give you a plethora to chose from of many different character types, set with there own powers and themes. This game gives you the bare bones to which you build off of allowing you to create your own champion, tailored to you and your play style. 3. No item store like DOTA2 or LOL. You literaly build your character through time and progression.4. You gain materials to build things after each match regardless if you win or lose. The more you win, the more bonuses are gained hence, the faster you can get your items built for your character. 5. 8 classes, many different ways to level each one giving you technically more then just 8 classes. Tank, Paladin, Sapper, Sister Of fire, Inquisitor, Berserker, Ice Witch, Gunner. 6. The games currency, is a pink gem that you can get through progression and time played along with getting a total of 5 after each time you level. Almost everything is reliant on this, respec, crafting and upgrading. You can literally earn everything honestly without ever going to the item mall. Over all thoughts thus farI honestly believe we have something great here. The game is well made on a nice engine and runs very nicely. There are a few graphical gripes, but nothing that completely ruins the game for me or my experience from the over all presentation. This game has a long ways to go before it can hit that sweet spot where DOTA and LOL currently sit at, but this game has the potential of being a staple in the MOBA market, maybe one that can make other DEV teams strive to become or even surpass. Thus far, I am having a blast and I already started to make friends on here and the community over all has been really nice to play with. There are a few toxic members, but thats in every gaming community no matter what you do. Now to the one spot where everyone wants to know about. "Item mall is it buy to win"  Buy to win for me is, you can buy all the best weapons in the game and armor at a premium cost and absolutely tank everything and not be effected by early adopters of the game. It's safe to say or atleast from what I have looked at, you CANT do that here. I was reading in the community hub that it was and had to look myself. There are boosts that are offered to get you more of those pink gems, but that was really all the differences they offer, not the crazy armor and weapon buying that people were claiming in the forums. The boost is pretty much you get additional gems with the completion of certain aspects of the game.  Not really game breaking considering half the people that do this wont be around very long or just don't have the time to keep up on the boosts themselves and let it expire. oh and one more thing, the crafting system is pretty nice and offers a similar experience to that of Warframe. Really nice idea to have something that allows us to make our own armors and weapons. "Now off to work I go, thank you for reading"  Devs, more game types and a server browser please.

er 28, 2013
												From what I've experienced so far, it's a simple arena style game. Dump the players into a map and fight various modes I assume, as I've only seen Domination so far(Simple king of the hill style of match). The classes have some nice variation, none of which I've seen are very overpowered or game unbalancing. The game has a nifty Crafting feature, which you use to make EVERYTHING; weapons, potions, equipment, etc. You randomly get materials by playing matches, and you can even trade for more somehow I've seen if you don't have enough materials. The only thing I've seen that I don't like so far is that it seems to take an oddly long amount of time to load, both starting up and when loading a match. Everytime the launcher is started, it re-scans the files before you can play, which for me takes 5 minutes. This is the first time I've seen anything use that method of file verification, and it's by no means a pleasant one. I wish they'll fix these sort of things soon, since it seems I personally have to wait 10 minutes or more before I can get into a match from the moment I launch the game.

content:
0, 2014
												Even if the game isn't the most popular of all, there is still plenty of people to enjoy it. You start your first character: You choose 1 of the 6 available classes at the beginning (2 more classes unlock as you level a character) and then choose your name and you're good to go. You can either choose to do the tutorial (which I think is basic but might help a bit) or start playing for real either in PvP or PvE. If you complete the tutorial, you get some potions and you automatically level up to level 2, which grants you access to a new skill (you can get a new skill every level for free).Now, for the gameplay, I think this game is original. Some might say it's repetitive, but you can always change tactics and team-play with your mates, which is the key to victory as Panzar is a team-based game. Each class has the same base mechanic: left-click for a basic melee attack and right-click for a powerful melee attack, which consumes energy (that replenish by itself or when you attack enemies with a normal attack and blocking, with CTRL. Then, as you level up, you get skills. Every class has really different skills that are useful in different situations. Those skills are placed on one or two skills bar in the bottom of the screen, using the F* keys or the numbers 0 to 9 on the keyboard. You can craft equipment from the materials you gain every time you finish a level, which are used to get more HP and Mastery. Mastery affects every attack and every skill by increasing their power, so they deal more damage. The thing is, even if you got equipment, your skills (real life skills, not the skills/powers in game) will really affect you in a good or bad way. There is no automatic aim and you need to aim your attacks and powers on your enemies by yourself if you want to deal damages.Graphics: Just, WOW. Probably the best graphics ever in a free to play game. Just to give you an idea, Panzar uses the CryEngine 3. Folliage, vegetation, lightning effects and effects in general are stunning. The textures are really good and all of that, maxed out, will require you to have a really good computer. However, I found that very intelligent, I got two computers: A really crappy one and a really good one, but both computers can actually play the game with decent FPS! One one the lowest settings and one on the highest... but, hey, I can still play on a crappy computer! That's an example of what I call a greatly optimized game.Cons: Crafting can be a pain as it requires a lot of time and a lot of ressources after a certain level, but it is still achievable. Another con is that half the players on this game won't really play as a team and mostly result in multiple defeats.Verdict: I really recommend this game and if you're not so sure about it, just try it! It's free after all. I almost have 350 hours on record and I don't even reached max level on any of my characters (max level is 30, which is plenty).I'd give this game a nice 8/10.

content:
er 26, 2013
												The premise of Panzar seemed like it could be a blast to play as I love RPG PvP games. However, after spending some time getting the game installed, updated as well as the times that I could actually finish a match without the game just randomly closing, it became apparent that this game is very shallow in the game-play department and is monetized very heavily.I encountered some problems with installation as well as this game didn't like my anti-virus solution requiring me to disable it during the installation of the game which shouldn't be necessary and is the first time I have had to do so in a very long time.The micro-transactions present in this game make it very much a pay to win game. They allow you to purchase hero levels, gear, consumables, etc which gives those who spend a good amount of money a significant advantage early on and a continued advantage later in the game.The tutorial was very short and is the same for each class save for the 30 seconds where the game allows you to use your class specific ability. For completing the tutorial you get enough experience to level up your character and some potions.The game-play itself felt very unrefined and balanced heavily around melee combat. Attacking felt very inconsistent as to if your strike would actually hit the enemy and blocking seemed very sluggish an unreliable. most class abilities are limited to a few uses before you are out of mana and then have to chug a potion to continue, engage in melee combat regardless if you are playing a melee class or not, or block and hope your team-mates are around to kill them while you recharge your primary resource. Death can take but a few seconds and then you must wait up to 20 to re-spawn.Pros: - It is free to play. - The game looks fantastic. - UI is clean and intuitive. - Shows promise if they can clean up combat and remove micro-transactions that grant characters power. Cons: - Combat felt very wonky. - Perceived low player amount as games I played were frequently not full and teams were lopsided. - I personally encountered installation problems as well as stability issues throughout my play time. - Heavily monetized to the point of Pay to Win.   -- Can purchase hero levels with real money to make character more powerful.   -- Can purchase gear with real money as an alternative to earning and crafting it.   -- Potion (Heath, Mana, and Energy) use is mandatory and you mush craft or purchase them.

er 26, 2013
												You know, at first I was really not considering downloading this f2p game.  It, to me, was similar to ArcheBlade - which is also f2p and I heartily recommend that.  Sure, there are things to purchase to speed up the time it takes to craft items, you can purchase items for crafting, purchase items outright, purchase 'premium' account time, etc.. but honestly I think they did this right.  The game is quite enjoyable, and some might call it a 'MOBA' game - don't know anything about it, can't compare them.  To me it's like a straight-on PvP (teams) deathmatch with arcane magic, orcs, dwarves, 'steampunkish' weapons, and no lag or stutter or frame rate issues.  Graphics are quite good, and overall it's an enjoyable game, and less demanding on reflexes than ArcheBlade is.  I recommend it.

content:
er 26, 2013
												Well what can I say about another MOBA style game with a pay to play front? The same as any other game. Dont take it serious, this game is all about brute force and how fast to can Power Shot your opponent. First things first: Play with friends. Trust me pre mades and Group fights are quickly a drawn back. Solo is not so great since the game rewards team work.The crafting system reeks of pay to win aspect, with a hint at "hey if you play long enough you might get that item you want." Which is ok for my self I dont mind. I dont like the fact that most items during the building/Crafting process take real time to make. Kind of lame and again very pay to win. you can spend money to speed up the process. crafting items are giving by winning and losing matchs. with varying amounts each time. Multiple play thrus will get you closer to that item you want. Skill Tree: muiltple skills with varying abilitys. My healing spells were very good for a rank 2 chacter. Points= EXP: Sadly no real large amounts of points where giving for healing. I healed about 17K one round and only got around 345 points. where as the lead team had about 1200 points. Game seems eager to give more points for Objective and Kills, rather then Support. Sucks but what ev. Graphics: looks very nice but unless you got the RAM to back it up some video LAG and Frame Rate drop because of muitlple players can get u killed. The maps seem repetative but still fun. Why I play it: meh it seemed nice and fun. Laughed alot due to the Ragdoll phys. again dont go with it being any different then other MOBA's. play with friends trust me.

content:
2016
												ММО-боевик — жанр популярный, но несколько однообразный. Какую игру ни возьми, везде перестрелки, пулемёты, гранаты и прочие атрибуты современного треша.Странно, что онлайн игра Panzar — явилась чуть ли не первой удачной попыткой сделать настоящий командный экшен в стиле фэнтези. Хотя идея очень долго витала в воздухе.Панзар - игра бесплатная и от русских разработчиков, что радует, так как проект сделан на мировом уровне, благодаря передовому движку Cry Engin 3 Конечно, это не Crysis с точки зрения физики.Зато всю мощь знаменитого немецкого движка вы можете оценить по графике игры, которая на голову превосходит всё, что я когда-либо видел в онлайне. С первых же минут вы сразу же убедитесь, что Панзар — это удивительно красивая ММО-игра.Рисовка уровней поднята на беспрецедентную высоту. Все текстуры проработаны очень качественно. Подобную графику не часто встретишь даже в современных офлайн-играх, чего уж говорить об онлайне, где модельки из десяти полигонов и локации, от которых вытекают глаза, вполне привычное явление.В Панзаре же мы видим совершенно иную картину - если это снег, то виден каждый сугроб, если это луга, то видно, как переливается на солнце буквально каждая травинка, если вода — то живая, журчащая, бегущая меж камней, скалы так и хочется пощупать, а уж какие здесь деревья! Прорисован каждый листочек, каждая иголочка на сосне. Причём пропорции персонажей и окружающего мира абсолютно реалистичны.Но графика — это ещё не вся игра, скажете вы, и будете правы.

content:
er 26, 2013
												If you are looking to play without paying, this game is probably not for you. While the gameplay itself is fine, the crafting system turned me off immediately. It toes the line of pay-to-win as close as possible, sometimes crossing it. You can buy gear with Crystals (premium currency). Or you can play a bunch of matches in hopes for the materials you need to craft a single piece. the act of crafting a single piece of level 1 gear (not counting farming the materials) is between 10 minutes to 1 hour. You can also circumvent the crafting time by paying Crystals as well. Need potions? Hope you have materials and time because you are crafting them. It preys hard on the player's patience.Gameplay, graphics, and map design are all rather good for a free to play. The mechanics of earning class points to cast powerful abilities is rewarding. The first time standing on the capture point as it rises up while the arena falls into lava was memorable. I was prepared to grit my teeth and bear the terrible crafting system until I imagined further down the line where a single piece of equipment could potentially take weeks to aquire. By the time I would aquire a SINGLE piece of level 1 gear, I would hit level 4 and a whole new set of materials and gear becomes available for crafting (or purchasing). I uninstalled shortly afterwards.

												Just a few thoughts on the game after the inital 30 minutes.- Just downloaded this game. It's riddled with display bugs - I set my resolution to 1920x1080 and I was unable to remove my cursor from the screen while in game. I set the resolution to 1600x900 - windowed mode, and the same issue persisted. - The combat is very clunky, and blood flys from your SWORD rather than the ENEMY you attack, very weird.- Some of the UI is cut off on the bottom, you can only see half of your icons on the hot bar which makes it frustrating to see which hotbar icons you are clicking or pressing via keyboard. - The game itself is visually appealing, and very pretty. Models are great, and the character design is very intuitive. Character creation is similar to WoW/MMO-like.Overall, very good visual state, just some lacking issues with the video displays, UI, and mouse overlay.

er 27, 2013
												The game is decent, but because there are potions, you can face opponents that just spam potions. Matchmaking is horrible, you can be level 1 facing level 10, with no way to do anything to them. The crafting is real time based, and you can spend real money to skip the timer. All the items that impact gameplay can be crafted, as well as purchased with real money. The opponents can block frontal attacks, but turning is faster than running behind, so they in 1v1 they can pretty much block you and wait for help to arrive. The game focused more on zerging than individual play. It's free so feel free to try it yourself. I quit after 3 games.

												Bland and dull. It's simply a constant deathmatch, with some classic handheld "f2p"-elements chucked in. To make matters worse, it took me an hour to get it to install and properly (SLI rig). It also has a habit of just acting wierdly, such as displaying the mouse cursor at random times. Tutorial is a three minute runthrough that apparently explains some lore. Besides the standard "use WSAD" to move, there's not much else being explained, such as class or game mechanics. I really tried giving the benefit of doubt, but after the fifth crash and tenth "failed to install third party component" I just gave up.All in all, 2/5. Could have been good, but in the end fails to deliver anything but a badly implemented CryEngine.

content:
er 29, 2013
												After booting the game up I met my first problem: the game wasn't scaling correctly for my ordinary monitor (BenQ G2450HM) so I had these black bars that covered my bottom abilities bar. So I changed to resolution to 1920x1080 and that didn't help at all. The game still has these weird black bars on every side and it looks cramped. Sure, I could see my abilities bar again but why can't the game be put on full screen? Why does it have to make it smaller and screw up my firefox on my second monitor? (BenQ GW2450HM) Christ almighty what a bad start.Ignoring those issues I thought that perhaps the game would be better. OH BOY WAS I MISTAKEN.The first 10 seconds into my game, it just stopped completely. It just shut down and Steam syncronized as it does when you close a game. Fine. I boot it up again. This time I got to do my character but then it crashed immediately. Great. So I go into the forums and apparently, I'm not the only one who gets constant crashing. So I do what they say: validate files on Steam. Sure enough the game has to download 54 missing files! Uuuh? What? Then my launcher tells me I have to download an additional 100mb of update. The game has been out since the 12th of April 2013. Perhaps time to step up your game development team?So after all that baloney I finally make my Dwarf Cannoner. I enter the the tutorial AAAND it crashes. WHOPPIE. What a fantastically optimized game. I launch it again and this time, I am able to play through the tutorial and get to the end. By the way, perhaps you should nerf the guards who defend the gate? Since they one hit the zombies and you can barely get a swing at the zombies before they die, I don't see why there is such a rush to help them defend. They could exterminate the entire tutorial island without an issue and still be back for tea time.After that god awful tutorial I click the big red button that says PLAY!My first map is the one with the lava that comes up from time to time. I rush out with my team and set up a machinegun so I can blast away the enemies. Except the gun does pretty much zero damage and I overheat my gun and get killed. My camera goes absolutely bananas when the lava starts coming up and then the game crashes! Majestical performance.I boot up the game and immediately press play and jump into a game. Before I go any further, is there some secret that I don't understand about respawning? I got into a fight and killed some mentalist guy and he respawned before I could set up my turret as a Dwarf cannoner. As I was building it, the same guy "bootlord" or something, came running up to me and bashed my head in. While my respawn timer was nearly 19 seconds long. He on the other hand had plenty of time running around, slaughtering my team. I saw no way of respawning faster or anything! I played the entire round but we got steam rolled since "Bootlord" or whatever his name was constantly ran out from spawn after he died and pretty much handed our poor, uncoordinated butts to us.Con's:-Can't handle 1920x1080 for some reason, ugly black bars and messes up my second monitor-Crashes if I try to play it-Energy bar is wack, drains if you jump while running at the exact same speed as running(!)-Who thought that having a fixed camera angle to your corpse on a moving platform was a good idea?-You need to update it several times before you can get it working for less then 20 minutes-Pay 2 win-Really glitchy hitboxes, Oh Mr. Orc, your swing hit my despite the fact that I was behind another character? GreatPro's:Easy to uninstall and especially easy to exit since the game does it for youAvoid at all costs. The grinding isn't even fun.

content:
ry 27, 2014
												This game pits you in PvP combat with mediocre gameplay. The weak gameplay wouldn't be too bad on its own since the teamwork part of gameplay isn't all that bad. Where the game really fails is its leveling and gear mechanic. You start at level 1 and are pit against players of all different levels. You have to level to gain power in a vertical climb which is made even worse by the gear which enhances everything about your character. To make matters worse, gear is crafted using random drops from PvP matches (the game ONLY has PvP). It'smuch simpler to buy the game's cash shop currency and get an entire set of gear for your level, however, leaving new players at the mercy of those who are willing to shell out cash. It's very unlikely you'll manage to get the materials you need to get gear at your level to survive in combat, so you'll spend hours getting one shot and bashed in the face by players who are higher level and have better gear. The game is a practice in masochism in both its leveling, gear crafting, and weak gameplay. I do not recommend that anyone play this unless they're willing to shell out cash to stay on an even battlefield with other players.This review was made at the behest of a player who countered my argument of, "If a player doesn't enjoy the game from the beginning, why would they suffer it until it stopped being terrible?" with, "You're an idiot."

content:
y 8, 2014
												Such a bad game, mega times on loading, had to tweek many things just to get it runing. Getting into a game with several classes is practicly impossible - 30 minute waiting for a game is not that everyone can handle. 2 minutes just to check for updates, so when i tried to just get it running, it took 2 hours from my life, and half of that was just because of the scanning that must be done EVERY SINGLE TIME, nevermind that you just checked 5 secs ago. OK, got it running (atlast), created a character, tried to play a tutorial, crashes again (after 30 minutes of searching for cure, found out that the game doesnt support certain properties of nvidia, fixed it no prob), i get into a game again, and to get you guys understand what i'm talking about is 5 minutes loading screen on my powerful PC. SO after 2 hours i run the game, create a character with a class i dont admire, quite an unpopular one, and i start searching for a MATCH. And i'm stuck on loading time once more, now 15 minutes of loading have passed already and there is no response what so ever in that regard. This is a disgrace, really, most of these F2P games are soooo damn uncoded, they have an excelent idea, but the programming background is so shady... I'm not the one to cry about F2P games, i just tried most of the games that are out there and i'm searching a game, which i would enjoy, and yet i could spend money on (i'm a game geek). Conclusion - another unsuccesful steam powered game, had HIGH expectations for this one, and yet again (like with Path of Exile) it let me down just because of the coding side of he game.

er 26, 2013
												EDIT: Since the infamous update which ruined the game COMPLETELY this review is no longer valid. This game is 100% Pay2Win. The launcher is buggy, requires to fiddle around and google for solutions for update. Game itself is fun, fast paced team arena style game. Controls feel responsive, although if not for the hit marker you wouldn't be even able to tell whether you hit somebody or not, becouse it feels like you are swinging in the air. Gameplay is fun, although most of the time it's steamrolling becouse everyone either uses tanks to spam and blitz win, or they spam with turrets which is no fun for the most part. The game itself however does offer many customization options in the means of armor, character looks and powers. It has a forging system which is tedious becouse it requires you to farm materials, and that takes time. And of course you can pay real money and level and equip your character fully as it is in the most games, which makes the game kinda P2 win. But for a F2P game it has a lot of potential and is at times extremely fun to play.

content:
y 8, 2014
												Such a bad game, mega times on loading, had to tweek many things just to get it runing. Getting into a game with several classes is practicly impossible - 30 minute waiting for a game is not that everyone can handle. 2 minutes just to check for updates, so when i tried to just get it running, it took 2 hours from my life, and half of that was just because of the scanning that must be done EVERY SINGLE TIME, nevermind that you just checked 5 secs ago. OK, got it running (atlast), created a character, tried to play a tutorial, crashes again (after 30 minutes of searching for cure, found out that the game doesnt support certain properties of nvidia, fixed it no prob), i get into a game again, and to get you guys understand what i'm talking about is 5 minutes loading screen on my powerful PC. SO after 2 hours i run the game, create a character with a class i dont admire, quite an unpopular one, and i start searching for a MATCH. And i'm stuck on loading time once more, now 15 minutes of loading have passed already and there is no response what so ever in that regard. This is a disgrace, really, most of these F2P games are soooo damn uncoded, they have an excelent idea, but the programming background is so shady... I'm not the one to cry about F2P games, i just tried most of the games that are out there and i'm searching a game, which i would enjoy, and yet i could spend money on (i'm a game geek). Conclusion - another unsuccesful steam powered game, had HIGH expectations for this one, and yet again (like with Path of Exile) it let me down just because of the coding side of he game.

If they fix the lag, load time, and crash issues, the game could be more than well worth the effort. Until then, I'd reccomend reading other reviews and possibly avoiding it all together.

content:
er 26, 2013
												EDIT: Since the infamous update which ruined the game COMPLETELY this review is no longer valid. This game is 100% Pay2Win. The launcher is buggy, requires to fiddle around and google for solutions for update. Game itself is fun, fast paced team arena style game. Controls feel responsive, although if not for the hit marker you wouldn't be even able to tell whether you hit somebody or not, becouse it feels like you are swinging in the air. Gameplay is fun, although most of the time it's steamrolling becouse everyone either uses tanks to spam and blitz win, or they spam with turrets which is no fun for the most part. The game itself however does offer many customization options in the means of armor, character looks and powers. It has a forging system which is tedious becouse it requires you to farm materials, and that takes time. And of course you can pay real money and level and equip your character fully as it is in the most games, which makes the game kinda P2 win. But for a F2P game it has a lot of potential and is at times extremely fun to play.

content:
er 28, 2013
												Mixed feelings about this one. I liked the class selection and found that each class was reasonably balanced, but the game does a lot of F2P elements that I dislike. Crafting is done via real time, so it can take hours (maybe days) to craft new equipment for your character. There are a number of other things that give off the feeling of pay2win. To be fair, I didn't spend a whole lot of time with the game, so I could be mistaken on that. The gameplay is basically King of the Hill with some variation depending on the map you are on. Hit detection is pretty weak (making it hard to determine if you're actually hitting your targets) and the animations are poor. The player-to-player collision is frequently obnoxious, because it allows you to push your allies around (or be pushed) and allies are often in the way. The game also follows the unfortunate trope of half-naked female characters.Overall, I had some fun playing it, but I can't really see myself going back for more.

content:
y 9, 2014
												I gave it the length of a regular feature film, about 90 minutes, before I decided it was a terrible waste of time.Starting with the Pay to Win features... from level 1-4 took those 90 minutes. You are able to craft gear, or buy it with real money. The crafting requires loot given at the end of matches, as well as a time restriction. By the time I had reached level 4 I was only able to craft 2/6 level 1 pieces of gear. Level 4 is the next tier for equipment, and I had reached it before having even HALF of the level 1 equipment crafted. Whereas if I spent real money, everything would just be mine... and I could go on to melt faces with my wallet protected character.Now the classes... I enjoy healing so I normally play support. In Panzar the healer is the Paladin... very low damage and very low survivability (As he can't heal himself unless healing others, and the self-heal is maybe 10% of what others are healed for). So basically any opponent who is paying attention can kill you fairly quickly. Gameplay is basically horribly imbalanced.Now for the player base. Many players just seem to ignore objectives and run into the closest fight. Players with experience never share it, they simply call everyone noobs when the team starts to lose. No advice or direction, no leadership... just insults.  It's basically like any online PvP oriented game.I would give this game a 3/10. Good ideas but a horrible execution.And my absolute least favourite thing is jumping. The jumping animation for character is terrible. Worst jumping I have ever seen.

content:
er 25, 2013
												Beautiful game, but the combat is horribly dry. It utilizes simple attacks and 'power' attacks, alongside several class-specific abilities that grow in number and power as your character progresses in levels. Unfortunately, the attack have very little 'weight' behind them, and typically one on one combat is devolved to strafing while tossing out little and big hits and the occasional burp of an ability. The fact there are currently no North American servers in operation is also a deterrant to American, Canadian and so on players that seek a PvP experience with a PING level promoting completely even playing grounds. Also refer to that fact that equipment can be outright bought with real life money, thus possibly leading you to combat peers with armor leagues ahead of what you could have possibly acquired without paying. This game is a neat concept with outstanding visuals, but the gameplay falls just short of being worth an extended commitment of time for your typical PvP-game hungry gamer.

content:
er 28, 2013
												The concept isn't bad, but the game needs a lot of work. The characters seem to move in slow motion, so there is really no way to attack someone without getting hit in return, which means whoever has more hitpoints when the fight starts pretty much wins by default. The animations are a joke, your character can't really jump without looking like he's trying to fake a moon landing, but for some reason he sniffs his pits every 5 seconds, then wretches at the stench. I guess pit sniffing took priority over smooth combat animations.The class balance is completely worthless, the tank class is essentially immune to ranged attacks, so since every single match is won by controlling a wide open control point whichever team has more tanks has an absurdly huge advantage. You simply can't win if your team consists of a majority of ranged characters, the win condition is controlling a point, and the enemy unit that does it can't be hurt from a distance. Healers can't heal themselves, so they are completely worthless unless your team has 2 of them that can heal each other, as the enemy will single out and kill a lone healer in seconds every time. Frost mages can freeze you solid, then kill you before you have any real chance to react. The slow animations really rear their ugly head when an enemy is using a highly telegraphed PbAoE spell that you absolutely need to avoid and you're simply unable to waddle out of its range or interrupt it before it hits you.One look at the team compositions will tell you who wins the match every single time. Since the reward for winning is twice what you get for losing it's extremely frustrating to rarely ever have a close match.This game is also the worst kind of Free to Play there is. From the moment you start the game it's clear that it is built to frustrate you unless you pay. Everything worthwhile is purchased with their premium resource. Whether or not you can get items without paying for premium is pure luck, as you have to construct them from resources that randomly drop from matches. The only upside is that the premium services are cheap, but the game itself simply isn't good enough to bother with.

The art direction itself isn't bad at all, and the animations are really really nice! But that's the only good part of the game.The gameplay itself is messy at best. Very short tutorial that explains the obvious, nearly no ingame feedback, high delay between action and effect (because, u no... animations!!). It is NOT a funny multiplayer game to handle. War of the roses has a far tighter multiplayer experience.And as any "good" free to play, expect nice pay to win! Yay...

6, 2014
												The Simple way to sum up Panzar is Arena Combat.Anyone who has played games will know what the main flaw of most arena combat style games is: Repetitiveness!!!!Even with the multiple classes and Rpg leveling elements after a few dozen matches of Panzar you will have seen and done everything there is to do in the game.On a positive note the combat is fluid and has its intense moments. The graphics are colorful with the animations and sound being sufficient.However there just isn't enough game here even for a free-to-play.Long before you win your 50th match and slay opponent 300 you will be wishing for something more to do and sadly will find little.

content:
r 26, 2014
												A lot of potential - but for now... SloppyInitial Thoughts:This game look great, interface is clean and easy to navigate. Queues are way to long with no real indication that the game is doing anything. I thought my system was slow loading at first but then I realized it was just the game rounding up players. PvP gameplay leaves a lot to be desired. Enemy tags sometimes show up late and since you are playing folks from all around the world there is latency issues. It is kind of chaotic at times. Doesnt feel as if you are doing any damage because there is no significant reaction to a successful hit, a small combat text is shown but it feels soft. A bunch of orcs swinging away on a capture point feels sloppy. If the devs went and played SMITE - copied their queue system and took notice to their combat - this game would be gold. Otherwise, I feel it will just fade away into nothingness.

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful
content:
y 12, 2014
												I played this game for a few hours under advices of friends who were really excited about it. Well, i tried it on the European server and i was immediately alerted by the limitations it has compared to the russian and american server (like 10 level minus, but the shop is updated with the american and russian ones, so there's this discrepancy). The game has also an high CPU/Ram requirement despite the description, causing crashes without alerts if the game exceed the pc limitations. I played a class a bit, then tried to delete the character and... 3 days of waiting to re-use the same name (maybe for the character spam). I created another character and i wrongly skipped the tutorial, which has no replayability and if you don't play it for the first time you have a good disadvantage on level and starting consumables. The game has also an high Pay to win dependency, having a 2€ cost if you want to respec (you can choose max 20 skill points over 30 because of the limitations, and if you fail you absolutely need to respec), amulets so difficult to craft and so important for the battle that should be bought and huge crafting times that can be reduced by, even here, paying. Last but not least, as every game born outside of steam and then re-adapted to it, it has account problems; you can't link your steam account with the official panzar site one, and vice versa, causing you to obviously use the steam system to buy those crystals and cannot use the official site to administrate your steam account.Classes, skill points and statistics are done well, but you can't create a game only using new abilities, classes and maps not caring about the rest of the game.Sadly i do not recommend this game. It could have so much potential if fixed well

er 27, 2013
												This game has the potential to be pretty fun. Its a free game so I shouldnt complain BUT, there seem to be more annoying things about this game than is worth ones time. I've crashed 5 or 6 times inexplicably (i just reached lvl 2), the voice acting is just absolutely GOD awful (once again, i know..free game, but better nothing than what rubbish they've done). I feel I spent more time at a loading screen than playing the game and lastly but not leastly, the combat feels very insubstantial. content:
er 30, 2013
												At first, the gameplay is pretty fun with a nice difficulty and the graphics are nice, but it became obvious really fast that it's just a bunch of pay to win garbage. A person who doesn't want to spend a ton on micro-transactions is put at a severe disadvantage. You can pay to do literally everything - not just cosmetic stuff, but items that boost your performance, and even just straight up paying for levels. On any given screen outside the arena, there are a dozen prompts to spend money via micro-transactions.

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
er 15, 2013
												Panzar's gameplay is Basically Stock MMORPG PVP Que's Wrapped up in the gorgeous Cry Engine 3 and for everything it does right it falls flat on something else.The Art style and theme bring enough to a simple game to feel as if it was a part of something bigger... But seemingly everything is ripped straight out of Warhammer it's comepletely amazing that this even got on steam with this much stuff completely ripped off.the Animations are well made. but there is a complete lack of feedback in mellee and ranged combats.The free to play model is fair, but you will quickly hit a point where sinking money into "premium time" is clearly the only way the games progression is balanced.There is plenty of gear slots and assorted things to slot into your gear. but there are only really 2 primary Stats to increaseThere are time sinks scattered through the crafting and upgrade systems that feel straight out of an iphone game and seem to only be in place to bait out the inevitible "ah ♥♥♥♥ it ill spend real money to skip this" you are also at the complete mercy of RNG with crafting mats rewarded after each match for......something.. there are no side objectives or anything to really influence how you get these.. just keep playing and hope.The Maps are really nice, most of them have moving components and other little quicks that bring some variety in how they are played out.. if only half of the modes where put together correctly. Maps like the Siege of ♥♥♥♥ing orc monkey village is backwards... and has the attacking team already in the castle and pushing out for what will always end up as a 45 minute meat grinder as there is no real way for defencive teams to win on any siege mode maps unless your teams composition completely ♥♥♥♥♥ on the attackers.i dont reccomend this one. At its core, this is a 5th of your typical mmorpg with an emphisis on milking fans of the genre for as long as they are oblivious to the massive flaws in the overall experience. 10/10goty's

content:
y 23, 2015
												I gave this game a try due to some positive reviews of other players, however I was disappointed. I tried the beserker class (damage dealer, melee)The graphic is okay, but not awesome.The controls are sluggish. It takes some practice to anticipate the enemies hit boxes correctly and fight effectively.You have two main currencies: rubies in exchange for real money, and gold which is earned with each match you play.I say "main currencies" because there is something else which the game calls "ingredients" or "crafting material" which is also earned with each match you play. If you are on "VIP"-mode (costs real life money) you get more. These materials are used for crafting new equipment. Since the material you get is generated randomly after each match this is rather useless. They could have left out this kind of "currency" and replace it simply with the gold as well. It's just something which I would call a "fake-feature".Crafting new equipment takes a lot of material. You get the possibility to craft new equipment by increasing your char level (done by experience gain through playing). While "light" and "medium" equipment seems achieveable in a reasonable amount of time, the best quality level "unique" takes material for which you can farm easily 50-100 matches (each match takes between 5 and 20 minutes). Then you have hopefully gathered enough material for one (1) crafting attempt. Yes, right, an "attempt"! For the "fun" of it you only have a -chance- of succeeding the crafting attempt. 70% for "light" gear, 50% for "medium" gear and 20% for "unique" gear, which only translates into even longer material gathering. If course you can increase the crafting chance, if you are willing to invest some rubies (money).Now comes the real absurd part: You can as well buy any equipment for a relatively small amount of rubies (real life money) instant.That is my major problem: Your choice is to spend hours over hours farming for materials for an item or you give in to the temptation and just buy the wanted item. The problem is the comparativeness. The pricing always suggest to just buy what you want, but why playing this game at all if I just by anything I could achieve? For me the game makes itself obsolete in this way.Add other factors like character designs which you can buy only for rubies (money) and which add "+xx.x% experience".Add other equipment which you can only buy for rubies (not craftable) and in addition have their lifetime limited to 3, 7 or 30 days, which means if you want a top equipped character, you *will* have to invest in the game regularly.Add consumables like heal potions which are also available for rubies (money) and if you don't have them, you can imagine the disadvantage on the battlefield.So at the bottom note let me say: This game leaves you no chance to make up a missing investment by very good or very extensive playing. Forget it! Since this is a PvP game (with some PvE side-content) you need to be top equipped to have a fair chance against others and this requires you to invest money - regularly!If you want to play to achieve access to better equipment and enjoy character progression, you will be frustrated and I suggest you stay away.If you just play for fun (PvP) without extras and you have no problem investing money regularly in order to keep your character in top shape, you can give this game a try.

er 26, 2013
												This game looks great, but it plays like garbage. The controls are oversimplified, with nothing beyond a few class-based abilities as well as the standard hit/heavy/block. Despite this being a game about combat, there is no kill counter, or clear way of knowing how effective you are actually being. To add to this game's problems, the crafting system is needlessly draconian, and, though I only played a dozen matches or so, it SEEMS that there is heavy P2W at work. Its free, so I wont tell you not to buy it, but if you've got limited bandwidth, you're better off just watching Netflix.

content:
, 2015
												Let's start off with that this game has huge potential and is incredibely fun to play. I love the mechanics of how certain classes can counter other classes which balances it just fine, unless your team doesn't cooperate, but otherwise it's a lot of fun.Really sadly the only and seriously only bad thing about this game is that it's PAY2WIN all the way which means you can pretty much complete the game using real money, you can get max level, you can get best gear in the game, you can get enough potions to make you immortal for the entire game, you can buy amulets which boost your stats and also you can buy a 'bot' of some sort so when you are not playing then he will 'play' for you resulting in you getting sweet loot without moving a finger, have I mentioned you can buy VIP which almost more than doubles the loot you get?Example:Once I went into a game withm my level 11 tank with decent gear for which i didn't pay and then further into the game i realised there is a guy on the enemy team who had all the available gear for that level, he even painted it which requires money like the game was so unbalanced because our team couldn't even kill him because he had enough health potions to keep him going for the entire game, he died like only once when our entire team ganged up on him, but that was it he just kept on killing everyone with two blows after that. This experience really proved to me how unbalanced the game gets when someone pays 2 win. This game has amazing potential, but the developers just ruined it with the cash shop.

content:
11, 2014
												I really enjoyed playing this game in its beginning launch and the next 200+ hours of gameplay over the year. The graphics and battle dynamics are outstanding, and initially it had a good crafting system. The resources you earned verses the cost of crafting higher end armor and weapons was scaled against you steeply but was acceptable. Sometime between 8/10/2014 and 8/11/2014 an update removed the ability to craft entirely, replaced with shop function only. Resources earned now, go towards a roulette game that doesn't nearly adheer to the probability statistics advertised. What was a great game for computer players has been reduced to a cell phone game in leage with "Kim Kardashian : Hollywood", you meerly pour money in for gear necessary for playing at high level. If they reverse the update launched on above dates I will probably continue playing, otherwise I just cant.

content:
y 18, 2015
												Graphics - 6.5/10 - Average - Some reason the goofyness feel and the cluster ♥♥♥♥ of idiocracy overdid it for me... I know plenty who like it however, it just didn't pull it off in my taste ;'/.Gameplay - 6.75/10* - Spectacular~! Note*: The game's build system is extremely crucial, unfortunately it feels like some skills can truly screw you up if you build improperly which makes me feel as if I'm too powerful, and other's are ♥♥♥♥. I presume that ruins gameplay for others which I took into rating.Community - 5.5/10 - The community is pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥, but if I was comparing to other MOBA's it'd be average 6.5/8.Customization - 4/10 - Growth is extremely unique to each and every character due to the large skills to pick from and limited points. I disliked one big thing was the equipment, there's only one way- Gearing upwards. Now the game is pretty screwed due to the fact people can now buy levels makes it feel.. Cheap.Replayability 6.5/10 - The game's different classes vary so much that everytime it's something different, each person brings a different build to the table. However, it is still a forward MOBA; Fight over and over except you can carry on some RPG-Elements such as leveling. Fun to try and gain, but I left primarily cause there's just better MOBAs out there, and the new "Buy levels" Option sort've killed it for me.Overall - Below Average (*5.15*); If the game didn't have the option to buy levels, and since they went with RPG-Elements why not more cosmetic options? It's a core thing, some people play RPG's, and one of the most rewarding thing is seeing the armor you got on you- And changing, evolving, and feeling more and more powerful.Unfortunately this game took on RPG-Elements, but didn't give something incentive to play for it - So people buy it, Over and out,-V.

content:
30, 2015
												First time, i got in touch with this game, was before it was on Steam, i played it a lot there.Game was really fun to play, very fun with friends.Later, when leveling, i was finding out that this game is going #SELLOUT mode...and it didn't change...I do not recommend this game, just because it's Pay2Win.(Pay2Win = Pay money to be better than other)You may see it by yourself - almost everywhere you can see some Pay2Win possibilities.Either you buy stuff with real money, so you craft gear at low lvl and own people...Or just simply boost yourself up to max(?) level paying 200€ (including gear).If you don't believe me - download this game, look for feature it offers, level a bit and you will see it.Enough about it's Pay2Win, which destroys this game completely, let's go to other stuff.This game is all about fight - you pick a class, make tutorial and just go fight.You earn score by doing what your class is supposed to do - either help your team by buffing or healing or fight enemies and kill them. Score also is obtained by capturing stuff, depending on map.Bigger score = a bit bigger in-game currency.You level your guy up, from in-game currency make gear (or just buy it by real money).___This game would get really big  rating from me, but since it's Pay2Win which destroys it completely, i give it low rating.My PERSONAL rating: 5/10

												The game only was able to run for about 1 hr, but in the hr I was shown a good IN GAME totorial but after that I was given the worlds WORST OUT OF GAME TOTROIAL, the way it runs is that the totorial takes entire comtrull of what you do. So if you want to say play the PvE to lurn the macanics of the game or even just play the game to ajust your video setting so you get a higher frame rate then 10. The game is FAR from playable.All of the other people who have revewed the game have said the game is pay to win (wich I havent been able to play enough to see) but I can say through studies and classes that I have taken to safely say that the FTP modle more often works if they have a well balenced game and the transactions are primaroly estedic with a few exclusive items or abilitys that are not any more effective on a statistical level then anything elce in the game.On top of all of this the options are almost impossible to use because the diffrence between all the settings is so insecnifogent that it makes no diffrence in profomince what so ever. This isen't even accounting for the pre alfa testing optomisation rounding the game off to an ungodly illprepropared game that should not have been released this soon.I will be updating this revew to its finle within the next year, but if I see no improvments or updates all will be left as is.

content:
25, 2015
												Gameplay-wise the game is great. Starting out when there are still an abundant amount of F2P in queue you can get in a lot of good matches. Towards early mid-game however all of that changes. The game becomes heavily P2W with players easily beating F2P players in a 6 vs. 1 match up using simple auto-attack spam. This isn't an exaggeration; the raw stats on the gear people pay to acquire allows them to one shot most F2P classes. End game is just what you'd expect. The only players up there are the ones competing with other players to out-P2W the competition. Skill becomes irrelevant. Save your time, play something else... unless you're dual wielding credit cards.
